definition: eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to lie through one's teeth (idiom)/to talk drivel

sentences.english: How , no study Chinese , open eye blind ?
sentences.chinese: 怎麼樣，不學中文睜眼瞎了吧？

sentences.english: When they could see again, Chiang was gone.
sentences.chinese: 大家再睜眼看時，江已經不知去向了。

sentences.english: Look around, it is happening all around you.
sentences.chinese: 睜眼看看吧，這就是你們周圍所發生的事情。

sentences.english: Reflexology is also offered at Open Eyes of Life.
sentences.chinese: 按摩，也可享有睜眼生命。

sentences.english: No dynasty had been so cosmopolitan and outward-looking.
sentences.chinese: 沒有哪個朝代如此熱衷於漂泊和睜眼看世界。

sentences.english: Let him only see the arrows who has eyes to see the rose.
sentences.chinese: 讓睜眼瞅着玫瑰花的人也望看它的刺。

sentences.english: He is busy to find, can just open eyes, soap will kill him in tears.
sentences.chinese: 他忙去找，可剛一睜眼，肥皂沫就殺得他直流眼淚。

sentences.english: Have client open eyes, and note blink reflex.
sentences.chinese: 囑受檢者睜眼，注重瞬目反射。

sentences.english: When Chou Chin awoke and saw where he was, he cried loudly and struck his head on the plate again.
sentences.chinese: 誰知周進睜眼看見號板，放聲大哭，又一頭撞去。

sentences.english: Do you also hope one goggle see a spring scenery is gorgeous?
sentences.chinese: 你也希望一睜眼就看到一片春光燦爛？

sentences.english: How many blind assumptions have youmade?
sentences.chinese: 你曾作出過多少睜眼瞎的假設呢？

sentences.english: Now my eyes will be open and my ears attentive to the prayers offered in this place.
sentences.chinese: 我必睜眼看，側耳聽在此處所獻的禱告。

sentences.english: Open right from wrong, close my eyes to calm thinking.
sentences.chinese: 睜眼明辨是非，閉眼冷靜思考。

sentences.english: Day breaks. Everybody opens your eyes, please.
Now I even look forward to having bad dreams so I can wake up and see you.
sentences.chinese: 現在我甚至期待做噩夢，那樣就可以一睜眼就看到你。

definition: to open one's mouth (to speak, esp. to make a request)/to gape
a moment/a while/in a moment/also pr. [yi1 hui3]
to rant and rave/to be scared, upset (Beijing dialect)
to open a door (lit. and fig.)/to open for business
